tool_description: This REST API service provides a way to programmatically split GPT-3 text-prompts into user-defined token-sized slices.
name: AI Tool - GPT Token Splitter
title: AI Tool - GPT Token Splitter

api_list.name: Using Path Parameters
api_list.description: limited input text size, limited delimiter quantity.

info.title: Info

status_desc.title: Status Description
status_desc.description: descriptive text on the status of the API service request.

date_time_start.title: Time Request Receieved
date_time_start.description: date and time, format: YYYY-MM-DDT:HH:MM:SS.ms. i.e. 2022-06-17T:12:06.253

date_time_end.title: Time Response Sent Back
date_time_end.description: date and time, format: YYYY-MM-DDT:HH:MM:SS.ms i.e. 2022-06-17T:12:07.585

info.description: A collection of generic API information.

user_provided.title: UserProvided

delimiters.title: Delimiters List of Strings
delimiters.description: see Request.delimiters schema for more information.

max_size.title: Max Slice Size In Tokens
max_size.description: maximum size of each text slice (in tokens). See Request.max_size schema for more information.

include_variations.title: Include Variations Boolean
include_variations.description: see Request.include_variations schema for more information

user_provided.description: A collection of information provided by the user.

total.title: Total Response Values

n_tokens.title: Total Number of Tokens
n_tokens.description: "n_tokens" represents the total # of tokens from the entire input text. In other words, it is the summation of all "t" for all "n_slices"

n_chars.title: Total Number of Characters
n_chars.description: "n_chars" represents the total # of characters from the entire input text.  In other words, it is the summation of all "c" for all "n_slices"

n_slices.title: Total Number of Slices
n_slices.description: "n_slices" represents the total # of slices from the entire input text.

total.description: A collection of total counts for tokens, characters, and slices calculated from the input parameters.

slices.title: Slices

t.title: t - Total Number of Tokens for Slice
t.description: "t" represents the total number of tokens in this specific slice of text.                                                    This number should be less than or equal to your "max_size" input parameter.                                                    The resulting value will depend on the processing of the input "text", the "max_size", and the "delimiters".

c.title: c - Total Number of Characters for Slice
c.description: "c" represents the number of characters in this specific slice of text.                                                    Use this value to split your input text a token slice of size "t".  You can also use the provided start and end indexs to split the text into a slice

s.title: Start Index of Slice
s.description: "s" represents the start index (in characters, not tokens) of the original text of a given slice

e.title: End Index of Slice
e.description: "e" represents the end index (in characters, not tokens) of the original text of a given slice

slices.description: A list of Slice objects. See Slice schema description.
